summary: A small tool that restores your Skyrim install to a vanilla state.
descriptionHtml:
[b]*v2.5 now available* [/b]with a brand new UI and lots of new features: [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/4697/?]http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrimspecialedition/mods/4697/?[/url]

[b]Skyrim Restore[/b] is a small Windows executable that temporarily moves vanilla files from the Skyrim folder, purges that folder and any configs then restores the vanilla files.

It doesn't know or care about NMM or Mod Organizer - it's just designed to return Skyrim to the state it was in when first installed.

To do its job it needs to know where your Steam folder is located i.e. [b]C:\Program Files (x86)\Steam[/b] - it'll work if you've installed Steam on a different drive too (assuming you put in the correct path).

It also has an extra feature: if you give it the path to a .7z archive (say D:\Archives\Skyrim_Mod_Archive.7z for example) it'll extract that archive over the vanilla Skyrim install, overwriting if necessary - I use it to try out/install different ENB setups.

The chosen archive is extracted directly into the Skyrim folder so if you wanted stuff to go in Skyrim/Data you'd need the Data folder to be in the root of the archive.

This is a tool I developed for my personal use - use it at your own risk - no warranties etc. If your Skyrim's a mess and re-installing's your only option then this may just help.
author: Brataccas
